GeneralInformation.School Vision: Nurturing Tomorrow's Leaders:  Creative Thinkers, Confident Communicators,  Lifelong Learners and Responsible Citizens.
GeneralInformation.School Mission: We are committed to providing our pupils with quality education, inspiring our pupils towards excellence, creating a caring environment and working in partnership with stakeholders.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: The school's core values, encapsulated by the acronym TGPS, which stands for Team Spirit, Graciousness, Perseverance, and Self-Discipline are integral in shaping the TGPS spirit and culture, and inspire judgment, decisions and actions. The learning environment is supported by a caring culture that encourages experimentation, learning from doing and peer learning.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Recognizing that different talents and skills are required for future employment, TGPS provides our pupils with a holistic education which includes a myriad of co-curricular programmes to augment the formal curriculum.  We strive to offer a balanced focus on the Cognitive, Character, Physical and Aesthetics & Cultural Development, respectively.    Authentic Learning Experiences To support cognitive development, pupils are engaged in learning activities customized to their developmental needs. To ensure that pupils experience authentic learning, TGPS offers a range of activities such as learning journeys, games and enrichment activities at appropriate junctures to provide opportunities for pupils to reflect and internalize their learning.    LLP: Confident Communicators with Ceramics, C3 An integration of the school's current key programmes of English, Art and Leadership Development, C3 aims to sharpen pupil's 21st century competencies through an expansive worldview as confident communicators, inculcating in them strong abilities to work in diverse cross-cultural environment. This program also allows for development of pupils' creativity, drive to learn and acquisition of art appreciation.  SEE @ TGPS (Science and Environment Education) The above aims to inspire a lively curiosity through an emphasis on the learning of scientific and technological developments in the global and local context.  Pupils are introduced to science and environment education from P1 to better engage them on related issues and impact on everyday life, guiding them to make responsible decisions on how to address such issues.  Pupils are involved in recycling projects, promotion of environmental awareness and Integrated Project Work based on environmental themes from P3 to P6.
